entry.title: The Gas and Electricity (Internal Markets) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations inter alia amend the Electricity (Northern Ireland) Order 1992 (“the Electricity Order”), the Gas (Northern Ireland) Order 1996 (“the 1996 Gas Order”), the Energy (Northern Ireland) Order 2003 (“the Energy Order”), the Energy Act (Northern Ireland) 2011 (“the Energy Act”) and the Electricity (Applications for Licences and Extensions of Licences) (No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2007 to ensure that they conform with the requirements of:

entry.title: The Apprenticeships (Transitional Provision for Existing Vocational Specifications) (England) Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order specifies the existing vocational specifications which are to be treated as if they were apprenticeship frameworks issued under section 14(1) of the Apprenticeships, Skills, Children and Learning Act 2009 (“the Act”). The existing vocational specifications are to be treated as being issued on 13th April 2011, and are to be treated as being withdrawn on 31st December 2011. The Schedule to the Order specifies, for each of the existing vocational qualifications, the qualification that is to be treated as the competencies qualification, and the level and apprenticeship sector that is to be treated as being stated in the deemed framework.

entry.title: The Legal Aid for Crown Court Proceedings (Costs) (Amendment) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Legal Aid for Crown Court Proceedings (Costs) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2005, which prescribe the Crown Court remuneration for solicitors and counsel assigned under Articles 29 or 36(2) of the Legal Aid, Advice and Assistance (Northern Ireland) Order 1981.

entry.title: The Medicinal Products (Herbal Remedies) (Amendment) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations repeal section 12(2) of the Medicines Act 1968 (“the Act”) which provides an exemption (from the requirement to comply with the restrictions set out in sections 7 and 8 of the Act) for the manufacture, sale or supply of herbal remedies where the process to which the plant or plants are subjected consists only of drying, crushing or comminuting and certain other specified conditions are met. With effect from 30th April 2011, this exemption is incompatible with EU legal provisions set out in Directive 2001/83/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the Community code relating to medicinal products for human use (OJ L No 311, 28.11.2001, p.67) and Directive 2004/24/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards traditional herbal medicinal products (OJ L No 136, 30.04.04, p.85).

entry.title: The Landfill Tax (Amendment) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations, which come into force on 1st April 2011, amend the Landfill Tax Regulations 1996 (S.I. 1996/1527) (“the principal Regulations”).

title.div: The Marine Licensing (Civil Sanctions) (Wales) Order 2011 / Gorchymyn Trwyddedu Morol (Sancsiynau Sifil) (Cymru) 2011

div.p: This Order confers on the Welsh Ministers, as an enforcement authority under section 114(2) of the Marine and Coastal Access Act 2009 (“the Act”), powers to impose fixed monetary penalties and variable monetary penalties in relation to certain offences under the Act.

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn rhoi pwerau i Weinidogion Cymru, fel awdurdod gorfodi o dan adran 114(2) o Ddeddf y Môr a Mynediad i'r Arfordir 2009 (“y Ddeddf”), i osod cosbau ariannol penodedig a chosbau ariannol newidiol mewn perthynas â rhai tramgwyddau o dan y Ddeddf.

entry.title: The Equality Act 2010 (Specification of Public Authorities) (Scotland) Order 2011

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Equality Act 2010 (Specification of Public Authorities) (Scotland) Order 2011
The Equality Act 2010 (Specification of Public Authorities) (Scotland) Order 2011

entry.summary: This Order amends the list of public authorities in Part3 of Schedule19 to the Equality Act 2010 (“the Act”) which are subject to the public sector equality duty in section149 of the Act. That is a duty to have regard to the need to eliminate discrimination, harassment, victimisation and any other conduct that is prohibited under the Act, to advance equality of opportunity and to foster good relations between persons who share a relevant protected characteristic and persons who do not share it.

entry.title: The Debt Arrangement Scheme (Interest, Fees, Penalties and Other Charges) (Scotland) Regulations 2011

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Debt Arrangement Scheme (Interest, Fees, Penalties and Other Charges) (Scotland) Regulations 2011

entry.summary: These Regulations are part of the revised Debt Arrangement Scheme for the repayment of debts in Scotland under Part 1 of the Debt Arrangement and Attachment (Scotland) Act 2002.

entry.title: The Marine Licensing (Civil Sanctions) Order (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: This Order confers on the Department of the Environment, as an enforcement authority under section 114(2) of the Marine and Coastal Access Act 2009 (“the Act”), powers to impose fixed monetary penalties and variable monetary penalties in relation to certain offences under the Act.

title.div: The Marine Licensing (Appeals Against Licensing Decisions) (Wales) Regulations 2011 / Rheoliadau Trwyddedu Morol (Apelau yn Erbyn Penderfyniadau Trwyddedu ) (Cymru) 2011

entry.summary: Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn sefydlu gweithdrefn apelau mewn perthynas â phenderfyniadau a wnaed o dan adran 71 o Ddeddf y Môr a Mynediad i'r Arfordir 2009. Maent yn gymwys mewn perthynas ag unrhyw weithgaredd morol trwyddedadwy y mae Gweinidogion Cymru yn awdurdod trwyddedu priodol ar ei gyfer o dan adran 113 o'r Ddeddf honno.

entry.title: The Legal Profession and Legal Aid (Scotland) Act 2007 (Modification and Consequential Provisions) Order 2011

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Legal Profession and Legal Aid (Scotland) Act 2007 (Modification and Consequential Provisions) Order 2011

entry.summary: This Order modifies section 75(4) of the Legal Profession and Legal Aid (Scotland) Act 2007 (“the 2007 Act”) ahead of that section coming into force and modifies other enactments in consequence of provisions of the 2007 Act.

entry.title: Land Registration (Electronic Communications) Order (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: This Order amends the Land Registration Act (Northern Ireland) 1970 (“the Act”) to permit electronic documents created within the Land Registry’s computer system, and authenticated by means of digital signature, to be valid for the creation, transfer, variation or extinction of estates and interests in land and to introduce conditions upon which electronic applications for registration may be made. These changes are intended to enable the electronic registration in the Land Registry of Northern Ireland of transactions affecting land.

entry.title: The Budget Responsibility and National Audit Act 2011 (Commencement No.1) Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order brings into force Part 1 of the Budget Responsibility and National Audit Act 2011 (c.4) (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Marine Licensing (Appeals) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations provide for appeals to be made to the Water Appeals Commission against marine licensing decisions and decisions to issue notices varying, suspending or revoking a marine licence or extending a period of suspension taken under Part 4 of the Marine and Coastal Access Act 2009 (“the Act”). Appeals can also be made to the Water Appeals Commission in respect of enforcement decisions.

entry.title: The Marine Licensing (Licence Application Appeals) Regulations 2011

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Marine Licensing (Licence Application Appeals) Regulations 2011

entry.summary: These Regulations establish an appeals procedure in relation to decisions taken under section 71 of the Marine and Coastal Access Act 2009. They apply in relation to any area, and any licensable marine activity carried on in that area, for which the Secretary of State is the appropriate licensing authority under section 113 of that Act.

title.div: The Marine Licensing (Notices Appeals) (Wales) Regulations 2011 / Rheoliadau Trwyddedu Morol (Apelau Hysbysiadau ) (Cymru) 2011

entry.summary: Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn darparu ar gyfer gwneud apelau i Dribiwnlys yr Haen Gyntaf yn erbyn rhai hysbysiadau a roddir o dan Ran 4 o Ddeddf y Môr a Mynediad i'r Arfordir 2009 (“Deddf 2009”).

entry.title: The Tunisia (Asset-Freezing) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision relating to the enforcement of Council Regulation (EU) No. 101/2011 of 4 February 2011 (OJ L 31, 5.2.2011, p.1) (“the Council Regulation”) concerning restrictive measures directed against certain persons, entities and bodies in view of the situation in Tunisia.

entry.title: The Egypt (Asset-Freezing) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision relating to the enforcement of Council Regulation (EU) No. 270/2011 of 21 March 2011(OJ L 76, 22.3.2011, p.4) (“the Council Regulation”) concerning restrictive measures directed against certain persons, entities and bodies in view of the situation in Egypt.

entry.title: The Education (Student Loans) (Repayment) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2011
entry.summary: The Regulations amend the Education (Student Loans) (Repayment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2009 (the principal Regulations). The principal Regulations provide the statutory framework for the collection and repayment system for income-contingent repayment (ICR) student loans.
